title: Relates to entitlement to first party benefits
summary: Establishes an insurer may not exclude basic economic loss from certain coverages; establishes where a covered person is guilty of operating a motor vehicle under the influence of alcohol or drugs that an insurer has a cause of action for the amount of first party benefits paid or payable on behalf of such covered person against such covered person.

       AN ACT to amend the insurance law, in relation to entitlement  to  first
         party benefits

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Paragraph 2 of subsection (b) of section 5103 of the insur-
    2  ance law, as amended by chapter 303 of the laws of 2010, is  amended  to
    3  read as follows:
    4    (2)  (I)  Is injured as a result of operating a motor vehicle while in
    5  an intoxicated condition or while his ability to operate such vehicle is
    6  impaired by the use of a drug  within  the  meaning  of  section  eleven
    7  hundred  ninety-two  of  the vehicle and traffic law; provided, however,
    8  that an insurer shall not exclude:
    9    (A) such person from coverage  with  respect  to  necessary  emergency
   10  health  services  rendered in a general hospital, as defined in subdivi-
   11  sion ten of section two thousand eight hundred one of the public  health
   12  law,  including ambulance services attendant thereto and related medical
   13  screening; OR
   14    (B) FROM THE COVERAGE REQUIRED BY SUBSECTION (A) OF THIS SECTION BASIC
   15  ECONOMIC LOSS AS DEFINED IN PARAGRAPH ONE OF SUBSECTION (A)  OF  SECTION
   16  FIVE THOUSAND ONE HUNDRED TWO OF THIS ARTICLE.
   17    (II)  Notwithstanding any other law, where the covered person is found
   18  to have violated section eleven hundred ninety-two of  the  vehicle  and
   19  traffic  law,  the insurer has a cause of action for the amount of first
   20  party benefits paid or payable on behalf of such covered person  against
   21  such covered person.
   22    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   23  it  shall  have  become  a  law, and shall apply to all policies issued,
   24  renewed, modified or altered on or after such effective  date;  provided
   25  that  if  chapter 303 of the laws of 2010 shall not have taken effect by
   26  such effective date, then this act shall take effect on  the  same  date
   27  and in the same manner as such chapter takes effect.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
